statement.p: In Biology class, students store their specimen's for labs at -22 ˚C. To thaw, a specimen is brought to a refrigeration unit. After 1 hour, the specimen's temperature in the refrigeration unit is -13 ˚C.
a. Sketch a graph to model the situation.
b. Calculate the rate of change. m = degrees per hour
c. The y-intercept is . What does it represent in this situation?

li.p: It takes 22 minutes to warm up.
The temperature goes up 22 degrees per hour.
The specimen starts at 22 degrees below zero.
